notes.text: You can now use the mass edit functionality in fields with side effects
We now support file uploads as action parameters using the Edm.Stream properties.
You can now override the columns, actions, and DataFieldForActionGroup in the Table building block
App developers can now enable the optimistic batch with a controller extension by setting disableRequestCache to False in the manifest.json file
Forms and tables in list reports and object pages now support the Common.Masked annotation
The Editing Status field in the list report now uses a select control instead of a combo box
You can now use the quickVariantSelection in the Table building block to define multiple views of a table
We've improved the performance of the mass edit dialog by reducing the number of requests when executing bulk changes in isolated mode
We've enhanced the performance of the mass edit dialog, reducing the opening time for large selections
We now also filter the value list description using hidden keys
We now wait for context to be created before extracting the inParameter for the value help dialog
You can now define the mass edit functionality as an aggregation in the Table building block
We now set the correct ValueState on the TextArea during data entry
We now ignore errors for canceled value help requests from older contexts
End users can now drag and resize the create dialog and action parameter dialog
We've resolved an issue where the navigation link was missing from the quick view title
We've resolved an issue where the filter field displayed an incorrect value upon application reload
We now show all decimals for quantity with measures in display mode
We now accurately detect the file type when uploading files using stream support
